name: Sim card
desc: I was pleasantly surprised to find this in my exchange student packet, which Tonya at the Global Programs Office of the Journalism School mailed to my home university in Hong Kong. I thought this was a thoughtful touch as we all know how daunting it can be to not be able to make calls or get online after arriving at a foreign place.

name: MTA anti-manspreading campaign postcard
desc: Bought this at the New York Transit Museum in Brooklyn. It is more of a representation of the strong feminist discourse in American society, than merely a subway souvenir.

name: Bike key
desc: Key to the bike that Chen lent me when I said I wanted to learn how to ride one. She's a journalism graduate student who has been an amazing friend these past few months.

name: Peppermint pillows from The Candy Factory
desc: A sweet find from when I was exploring downtown Columbia for the first time. The Candy Factory is one of the must-visit places downtown.

name: Bulletin board outside my dorm room
desc: I was pleasantly surprised to find this outside the room when I first moved in. I've always wondered if they had purposefully matched the position of the globe to where the person is from.

name: MHacks9 badge
desc: My badge for MHacks9, the biggest US college hackathon which is held at the University of Michigan.

name: Souvenir coin from the American Museum of Natural History
desc: I got to admit that the reason I went was to relive some Night at the Museum memories.

name: Mizzou Pennant
desc: From my exchange student packet. First pennant I own.

name: Guggenheim postcard
desc: One of the coolest art museums in NYC.

name: Anheuser-Busch brewery tour ticket
desc: Not a fan of beer, but it was an interesting experience. And we got free beer.

name: Stamped page Missouri state parks passport
City Museum wristband
desc: A place that can really instill creativity in children. Definitely makes one question how adults often lose the carefree mindset that we once had as a child.

name: NYC subway MetroCard
desc: This may be one of the most unreliable creations of mankind. I have had two tickets over a week-long trip.

name: Pins by the New York Times and the Washington Post
desc: From the Society for News Design workshop swag bag. The war on media is so dire that they have to make pins about it.

name: MetroLink One-Day Adventure Pass
desc: One of the more eyeopening public transit experiences I've had was on the MetroLink.

name: Society for News Design workshop badge
desc: The most functional and well-designed conference badge I've seen.

name: Mizzou student card
desc: My student card at the University of Missouri. That's a photo I took on my second day in Columbia.
